page.title: 15DURHAM PIKELETS
page.content: DURHAM PIKELETS are very good for tea.They are served hot and but- tered piled up on a plate.Sift 200g flour with 50g caster sugar and a good pinch of salt into a basin.Get some buttermilk or milk and little by little stir in about 125ml of it just enough to make a thick batter. Melt 1teaspoon bicarbonate of soda in 2 tablespoons of boiling water.Stir this in too.Now grease a frying-pan and get it hot.Take a table spoon and drop the batter on to the hot pan in rounds from the spoon but keep them a bit apart as they spread. Fry your pikelets until they are brown below and bubbly on top, then turn them with a fish slice and fry the other side.Put plenty of butter on them and eat them before they are cold.
